thing-type.label: FGK101 Door Opening Sensor
thing-type.description: Door Opening Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<strong&gtFIBARO Door/Window Sensor</strong&gt is a wireless, battery powered reed sensor compatible with the Z-Wave standard. Changing the device’s status will automatically send signal to the Z-Wave controller and associated devices. </p&gt <p&gtSensor can be used to trigger scenes and everywhere there is a need for information about opening or closing of doors, windows, garage doors, etc. Opening is detected by separating the sensor’s body and the magnet.</p&gt <p&gtIn addition the FIBARO Door/Window Sensor supports one DS18B20 temperature sensor and has one potential free input.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtQuickly, three times press the TMP button. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtQuickly, three times press the TMP button. </p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtTo wake up the sensor manually, click one of the TMP buttons (while the other button is pressed).</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Operations mode
parameter.description: Parameter defines device operation mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor<br /&gt1 - external button</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Door/Window or alarm status
parameter.description: Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... is close. If the alarm sensor is connected, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor<br /&gt1 - external button</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Visual LED indications
parameter.description: This parameter defines events indicated by the visual ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... LED indicator. Disabling events might extend battery life.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - no indications<br /&gt1 - indication of opening/closing status change<br /&gt(input IN)<br /&gt2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical)<br /&gt4 - indication of device tampering</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: Range test after double click
parameter.description: Allows to enable activation of Z-Wave range test with ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... double click of a TMP button.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - disabled<br /&gt1 - enabled</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: 2nd association group triggers
parameter.description: Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1). </p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - switch after opening and closing<br /&gt1 - switch after opening<br /&gt2 - switch after closing</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Commands sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - ON<br /&gt1 - OFF<br /&gt2 - ON &amp; OFF</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: ON command sent to 2nd assoc. group
parameter.description: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it On. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set<br /&gtan associated device to a specifed level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: OFF command sent to 2nd assoc. group
parameter.description: The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIn case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level</p&gt <p&gtThe value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it On. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set<br /&gtan associated device to a specifed level.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_2
parameter.label: 14: Time delay of ON command frame
parameter.description: Time period after which ON command frame will be sent.

parameter.name: config_15_2
parameter.label: 15: Time delay of OFF command frame
parameter.description: Time period after which OFF command frame will be sent.

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Type of sent alarm frames
parameter.description: Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... and 3rd association group “Alarm”. If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - Door/Window Sensor (General Purpose Alarm)<br /&gt1 - smoke sensor (Smoke Alarm)<br /&gt2 - CO detector (CO Alarm)<br /&gt3 - CO2 detector (CO2 Alarm)<br /&gt4 - high temperature sensor (Heat Alarm)<br /&gt5 - flood sensor (Water Alarm)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_2
parameter.label: 30: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
parameter.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
parameter.description: Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... and 5th association group.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - do not send tamper cancellation report<br /&gt1 - send tamper cancellation report</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_50_2
parameter.label: 50: Interval of temperature measurements
parameter.description: This parameter defines how often the temperature will ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - temperature measurements disabled<br /&gt5-32400 - time in seconds</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_51_2
parameter.label: 51: Temperature reports threshold
parameter.description: This parameter defines the change of temperature in ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt...comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled<br /&gt1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30°C, 0.1°C step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_52_2
parameter.label: 52: Interval of temperature reports
parameter.description: This parameter determines how often the temperature ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... reports will be sent to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - periodic temperature reports disabled<br /&gt5-32400 - time in seconds</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_53_4
parameter.label: 53: Temperature offset
parameter.description: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... by the sensor (temperature compensation).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt-1000-1000 (-100-100°C, 0.1°C step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_54_1
parameter.label: 54: Temperature alarm reports
parameter.description: Temperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - temperature alarms disabled<br /&gt1 - high temperature alarm<br /&gt2 - low temperature alarm<br /&gt3 - high and low temperature alarms enabled</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_55_2
parameter.label: 55: High temperature alarm threshold
parameter.description: If temperature is higher than set value, overheat ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0-1000 (0-100°C, 0.1°C step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_56_2
parameter.label: 56: Low temperature alarm threshold
parameter.description: If temperature is lower than the set value, underheat ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt-300-700 (-30-70°C, 0.1°C step)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_70_2
parameter.label: 70: Scene activation functionality
parameter.description: The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... to different events. To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. To activate all scenes set the value to 3903.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt1 - [ID 10] opening door/window (single click)<br /&gt2 - [ID 11] closing door/window (single click)<br /&gt4 - [ID 12] holding<br /&gt8 - [ID 13] releasing<br /&gt16 - [ID 14] double click<br /&gt32 - [ID 15] triple click<br /&gt256 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window<br /&gtopened<br /&gt512 - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window<br /&gtclosed<br /&gt1024 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window<br /&gtopened<br /&gt2048 - [ID 51] low temperature - door/window<br /&gtclosed</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_71_1
parameter.label: 71: Alarm broadcast
parameter.description: Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. They are not repeated by the mesh network.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - broadcasts inactive<br /&gt1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active<br /&gt2 - sensor alarm broadcast active<br /&gt4 - tamper alarm broadcast active</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_72_1
parameter.label: 72: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
parameter.description: This parameter defines how commands are sent in ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt... specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group “Lifeline”.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings:</p&gt <p&gt0 - none of the groups sent as secure<br /&gt1 - 2nd group ”Control” sent as secure<br /&gt2 - 3rd group ”Alarm” sent as secure<br /&gt4 - 4th group “Sensor ZW3” sent as secure<br /&gt8 - 5th group “Tamper ZW3” sent as secure</p&gt <p&gt15 - (all)</p&gt</p&gt
